document.docAuthor: Yao, Gang, Yang, Ding & Evenhuis, Neal L.
document.masterDocTitle: First record of the genus Euchariomyia Bigot, 1888 from China (Diptera: Bombyliidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: First record of the genus Euchariomyia Bigot, 1888 from China (Diptera: Bombyliidae)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Bombylius pulchellus
Wulp, 1880
: 164
. Type locality: Indonesia (Java).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Euchariomyia dives
Bigot, 1888
a: cxl [ 1889 : cxl (as
Eucharimyia
)]. Type locality: Sri Lanka .

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Bombylius wulpii
Brunetti, 1909 a
: 457
(new replacement name for
Bombylius pulchellus
Wulp, 1880
).

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. Sides of frons just above antennae with long hair-like white scales; sides of clypeus with long hairlike white scales. Dorsum with dense white reflective recumbent scales almost covering whole surface of abdominal dorsum (male only).

caption.paragraph:

head. 2. male head lateral view; 3. male head front view; 4. female head lateral view; 5. female head front view.

subSubSection.paragraph: Description. Male. Body length 5â€“6 mm , wing length 6â€“7 mm .

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 6â€“7.
Euchariomyia dives
abdomen. 6. male dorsal view; 7. female dorsal view.

FIGURES 9â€“10.
Euchariomyia dives
female genitalia. 9. ventral view; 10. spermathecal bulb.

subSubSection.paragraph: Thorax black with grey pollen except scutellum with brown pollen. Hairs on thorax mostly yellow, bristles black; postpronotal lobe with long yellow hairs, mesonotum with long yellow hairs anteriorly and three long black lateral bristles near base of wing, close to base of wing with long white hair-like scales, postalar callus with three black bristles. Scutellum almost bare but just with yellow hairs on anterior edge; scutellum with eight black bristle on posterior edge. Legs dark. Hairs on legs black, bristles black. Femora with sparse long black hairs; tibiae and tarsi with short black hairs. Hind femur with three av apically. Mid tibia with five ad , four pd , five av and five pv ; hind tibia with six ad , eight pd , six av and eight pv . Wing mostly infuscate, dark brown to light brown from base and anterior margin to tip and posterior margin, with metallic reflections. Base of anal lobe and alula with dark brown hairs on margin. Vein m 1 not reaching edge, basal medial cell with a dark spot on angle close to basal radial cell and discal medial cell. Halteres brown.

Distribution. Burma , China (Guangxi), India (Kerala, Orissa, Tamil Nadu, Uttar Pradesh), Indonesia (Java), Laos , Sri Lanka , Thailand .

Remarks. We found specimens of this species on days with good sunshine; most of these specimens were collected while they were visiting railway beggarticks (
Bidens pilosa Linnaeus
; Asteraceae ) (Fig. 1 ). The species flies slower than other genera of bee flies. The environment in which we found this species is similar to that where locusts oviposit, so future collecting of this species in China and elsewhere should also look for possible parasitoid associations between this species and locusts.
